1.text: And Mordecai knew all that was done, and Mordecai will rend his garments, and put on sackcloth and ashes, and he will go forth into the city, and he will cry out a great and bitter cry;

2.text: And he will come even before the king’s gate: for none to come into the king’s gate in putting on sackcloth.

3.text: And in every province and province the place where the word of the king and his edict coming, great mourning to the Jews, and fasting and weeping and wailing; sackcloth and ashes will be spread to many.

4.text: And Esther’s maidens will go in, and her eunuchs, and they will announce to her: and the queen will be greatly grieved; and she will send garments to clothe Mordecai and to put away his sackcloth from off him: and he received not.

5.text: And Esther will call to Hatach from the king’s eunuchs, whom he caused to stand before her, and she will give him a charge to Mordecai, to know what this, and for what this.

6.text: And Hatach went forth to Mordecai to the broad place of the city, which was before the king’s gate.

7.text: And Mordecai will announce to him all which befell him, and the exposition of the silver which Haman said to weigh to the king’s treasures for the Jews to destroy them.

8.text: And the copy of the writing of the edict which was given in Shushan to destroy them, he gave to him to cause Esther to see, and to announce to her, and to charge upon her to go in to the king to implore mercy, and to seek from before him for her people.

9.text: And Hatach will go in and announce to Esther the words of Mordecai.

10.text: And Esther will say to Hatach, and will give him a charge to Mordecai;

11.text: All the king’s servants, and the people of the kings provinces, knowing that every man and woman who shall go in to the king to the inner enclosure who shall not be called, one edict of his to put to death only which the king shall stretch out to him the sceptre of gold, and he lived: and I was not called to go in to the king this thirty days.

12.text: And they will announce to Mordecai, Esther’s words.

13.text: And Mordecai will tell to turn back to Esther, Thou wilt not imagine in thy soul to escape in the house of the king more than all the Jews.

14.text: For if being silent, thou shalt be silent in this time, breath and deliverance shall stand up to the Jews from another place; and thou and thy father’s house shall be destroyed: and who shall know if for a time like this thou camest to the kingdom?

15.text: And Esther will tell to turn back to Mordecai:

16.text: Go collect together all the Jews being found in Shushan, and fast ye for me, and ye shall not eat and ye shall not drink three days, night and day also I and my maidens will fast thus and in this I will go in to the king which is not according to the edict; and according to that I perished, I perished.

17.text: And Mordecai will pass by, and will do according to all that Esther charged upon him.
